trans-unit.source: Organizes style characteristics of an ASP.NET mobile control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The base <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class contains style characteristics common to all mobile controls.
Classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class contain additional style characteristics specific to their associated control.
Due to the diversity of devices supported by mobile controls, all style properties are advisory, and might or might not be honored depending on the capabilities of the target device.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific"></xref> property to the specified object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method does not support multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecific> objects and will throw an <xref:System.Exception> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific%2A> property is not `null` when <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.AddParsedSubObject%2A> is called.
The object to be set as the value of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific"></xref> property is not `null`.
Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Alignment%2A> property can be set to any of the following values:
Value
Description
No alignment is set for the specified object.
Aligns to the left.
Aligns to the center.
Aligns to the right.
An enumerated value representing the specified alignment for the style.
Represents the key used to retrieve the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Alignment"></xref> setting of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Applies the properties of a style to a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The following control properties are affected:
Property
Description
The size of the font.
Whether the font is bold.
Whether the font is italic.
The foreground color.
The background color.
The control to which the style properties are applied.
Gets or sets the specified background color for the style.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Unlike the other properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property is not inherited from its parent.

For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit a background color of cyan; you must explicitly set the child control's `BackColor` property to cyan, or you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control.
This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.
The specified background color for the style.
The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor"></xref> property.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for setting the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Bold"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font"></xref>.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a copy of this instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A copy of this instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref>.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property returns the control that is the container for the specified style.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control.
The accessor returns `null` if no such construct exists.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control.
Returns a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo"></xref> object that contains font information about the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FontInfo> class has the following properties:
Property
Description
Whether the font is bold.
Whether the font is italic.
An identifier for this font instance.
The font size.
An enumerated value specifying the font information about the control.

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Name"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font"></xref> property.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Size"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font"></xref> property.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style.
Typically, this property sets the color for the text.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.ForeColor%2A> property to display text in different colors.
The strings that can be used for colors are a set of fixed colors and hexadecimal RGB values.
These values can also be specified as "#bb7023".
You can also use the Microsoft Windows color constants.
The specified foreground color for the style.
The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.ForeColor"></xref> property.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the template with the specified name.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns `null` if the control is not templated, or if the template does not exist in the selected template set.
The name of the specified template.
The template with the specified name.
Gets a value indicating whether a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object has an active template set.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

To be considered templated, an object must have a [\<DeviceSpecific>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5984e67a-91cf-4f32-8815-7e7fab3d3b5b) element with a `<Choice>` element successfully evaluated for the target device.
The selected choice must have templates defined.
`true` if the style has an active template set; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object is saving changes to its view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the control is tracking changes to its view state; otherwise, `false`.

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Italic"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font"></xref> property.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the style through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The key of the style to get or set.
The style specified by the given key.
Returns the style, through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The key of the style to get or set.
`true` to use inheritance; otherwise, `false`.
The style specified by key.
Loads the view state into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.State"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
The object containing the view-state information.
Gets or sets the name of the specified object.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the specified object.
Registers a style property and returns a unique key for lookup.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called only from inherited style classes.
The name of the style property.
The type used for the property.
The default value of the property.
Indicates whether the style inherits from parent objects.
The default is `true`.
A unique key for lookup.
Saves the changes to the view state to an <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object that contains the view state.
Gets the current contents of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The current contents of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property must be the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property to share styles across controls, either by using inheritance or by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property of a style sheet.

For more information, see [Styles](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ba186999-7707-426b-9376-7eed6970e7b1) and [Creating New Styles](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/da7f9825-3cc7-4c0f-9800-7d3cb15041d1).
A reference to the style properties for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
Turns on the tracking of view state in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property to `true`.

It also calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.State%2A> property.
Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The following table contains the definitions of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping> enumerations.
Enumeration
Value
Description
No size is set for the specified object.
This is the default value.
Wrap to the next line.
The text is not wrapped to the next line.
An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.
The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Wrapping"></xref>.
Used internally by ASP.NET.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor.AddParsedSubObject(System.Object)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor> interface.
The parsed subobject to be added.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState(System.Object)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The object representing the view state to be loaded.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
